intro: Borkhausenia intermedia, commonly known as the silverleaf borkhausenia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub that typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, characterized by its silvery-gray foliage. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers during the cooler months, which attract various pollinators. Its leaves are succulent and adapted to store water, making it drought-tolerant. Borkhausenia intermedia is often used in xeriscaping due to its low maintenance and ornamental value.
